[[File:Battlefield 3 trailer still.jpg|thumb|right|A US Marine readies a rocket launcher in a Middle Eastern city, protected by his squad in a screen shot from the upcoming Battlefield 3 game.]]<!-- Justification: 1. There is No free equivalent. 2.There is Respect for commercial opportunities in that there is no copyrighted media equivilent that is sold of screen shots. 3. There is minimal usage on page and has a minmal extent of use as it is seen in thumbnail form. 4. This same image has seen Previous publication on the company's website as they are legally affiliated with image owners EA. 5. Image is used to showcase technology discussed in article and meets criteria for content. 6. Meets the Media-specific policy under fair use. 7. Images meets One-article minimum criteria, being used not only in this article, but also the Battlefield 3 article. 8. Image has Contextual significance in that Battlefield 3 uses lighting technology from article subject as referenced on page. 9 Meets Restrictions on location criteria as this article is the main namespace for the subject. 10. Image description page has been in place and in use for its reference to the Battlefield 3 page. This image placement meets every criteria for use on this page.~~~~ -->
+
[[File:Battlefield 3 trailer still.jpg|thumb|right|A US Marine readies a rocket launcher in a Middle Eastern city, protected by his squad in a screen shot from the upcoming Battlefield 3 game.]]
Enlighten is incorporated into the [[Frostbite Engine|Frostbite 2]] engine<ref>Kenny Magnusson (DICE) ,[http://publications.dice.se/ "Lighting you up in Battlefield 3"], GDC 2011</ref>, created by [[Electronic Arts|EA]] DICE studio. It can be seen in ''[[Battlefield 3]]''<ref>EDGE, May 2011, p28-29</ref>, and ''[[Need for Speed: The Run]]''{{Citation needed|date=July 2011}}. Enlighten has been licensed for a variety{{Citation needed|date=July 2011}} of other titles including ''[[Eve Online]]''<ref>http://www.geomerics.com/news/geomerics_ccp.html</ref>.
Enlighten is incorporated into the [[Frostbite Engine|Frostbite 2]] engine<ref>Kenny Magnusson (DICE) ,[http://publications.dice.se/ "Lighting you up in Battlefield 3"], GDC 2011</ref>, created by [[Electronic Arts|EA]] DICE studio. It can be seen in ''[[Battlefield 3]]''<ref>EDGE, May 2011, p28-29</ref>, and ''[[Need for Speed: The Run]]''{{Citation needed|date=July 2011}}. Enlighten has been licensed for a variety{{Citation needed|date=July 2011}} of other titles including ''[[Eve Online]]''<ref>http://www.geomerics.com/news/geomerics_ccp.html</ref>.
